info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 22 at 3:39PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Susquehanna and east central Bradford Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 339 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Rushville, or 7 miles northeast of Wyalusing, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Rush, Springville, Montrose, Dimock, Herrick, Wyalusing, Hop Bottom, Le Raysville, Brushville and Rushville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for northeastern Pennsylvania.
